item.title: 敦促英国放宽规划规则，让电网为 2030 年做好准备
item.description: 一位政府顾问表示，英国需要放宽规划规则，以确保其瘫痪的电网能够应对更高的需求和可再生能源电力的大规模建设。【原文：The UK needs to relax planning rules to ensure its choked electricity grid can cope with higher demand and a massive build-out of renewable power, a government adviser said.】

item.title: 日本最大核电站复兴面临最后障碍
item.description: 经过十多年的闲置，日本最大的核电站已准备好重新启动；但它面临着无限期的等待。【原文：After more than a decade of inactivity, Japan’s biggest nuclear power plant is ready to restart — but it faces an indefinite wait.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴尔离任前一周发出风险警告
item.description: 美联储银行业最高负责人迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）恳请监管机构对金融体系面临的风险保持警惕，因为他准备卸任负责监管的副主席一职，同时继续留任理事会成员。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s top bank cop, Michael Barr, implored regulators to stay vigilant about risks to the financial system as he gets ready to step down from his role as vice chair for supervision while remaining on the Board of Governors.】

item.title: 英国国家环境基金（BNEF）称，到 2050 年，巴西的净零排放转型将耗资 6 万亿美元
item.description:
根据新的分析，可再生能源发电能力已经在稳步增长，但是通过让更多的电动汽车上路，中国可以加快减排速度   

。【原文：

Renewable power capacity is already growing at a steady pace, but the country can accelerate its emissions reductions by getting more electric vehicles on the road, according to new analysis.  

】

item.title: 南非领导人敦促二十国集团团结一致应对全球挑战
item.description: 南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨敦促二十国集团搁置分歧，集中精力应对世界最紧迫的挑战。【原文：South African President Cyril Ramaphosa urged the Group of 20 nations to set aside their differences and focus on tackling the world’s most pressing challenges.】

item.title: 肆虐美国中部的冬季寒潮打破气温记录
item.description: 在周末温和天气到来之前，美国中部和南部地区至少还将遭受一天的严寒，一些城市的气温将跌至历史最低点。【原文：Intense cold will grip the central and southern US for at least another day, sending temperatures to all-time lows in some cities before milder weather is set to arrive over the weekend.】

item.title: 银行退缩，英国新气候组织崛起
item.description:
当美国金融公司躲避右翼分子对可持续发展的攻击时，过渡金融委员会正在利用城市和其他方面的力量来扩大脱碳规模。【原文：

While US financial firms flee right-wing attacks on sustainability, the Transition Finance Council is tapping the City and others to scale decarbonization.

】

item.title: 印度小麦作物面临收获前温暖天气的威胁
item.description: 印度本月将面临更加温暖的天气和稀少的降雨，这将威胁到该国的小麦作物，并提高了政府削减或取消谷物进口税的可能性。【原文：India is facing more warm weather and sparse rain this month, threatening the nation’s wheat crop and raising the prospect of the government cutting or removing an import duty on the grain.】

item.title: 生物多样性谈判失败后重启，目标筹资 2,000 亿美元
item.description:
"每个人都认识到生物多样性的急剧减少，"记者娜塔莎-怀特在本周的《零点》节目中说道。"它影响着世界上的每一个国家。【原文：

“Everybody recognizes this drastic loss in biodiversity,” reporter Natasha White says this week on Zero. “It's affecting every country in the world.”

】

item.title: 力拓首席执行官表示，气候目标仍有商业价值
item.description: 世界第二大矿业公司、污染大户力拓集团（Rio Tinto Group）站出来支持企业遏制排放的努力，坚持认为追求绿色目标可以增加价值。【原文：Rio Tinto Group, the world’s second-largest mining company and a major polluter, came out in support of corporate efforts to curb emissions, insisting that pursuing green targets can add value.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行、桑坦德银行和巴克莱银行在二氧化碳排放融资方面名列前茅
item.description: 彭博情报公司（Bloomberg Intelligence）的分析师称，法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）、桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）和巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）是目前和预测融资二氧化碳排放量最高的银行。【原文：BNP Paribas SA, Banco Santander SA and Barclays Plc stand out as the best among banks in terms of their current and forecast financed CO2 emissions, according to analysts at Bloomberg Intelligence.】

item.title: 随着特朗普清洗范围扩大，联邦紧急事务管理局瞄准气候和多元化工作人员
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士和彭博新闻社看到的一封联邦紧急事务管理局的内部邮件称，在本周早些时候数百名试用期员工被解雇后，联邦紧急事务管理局与气候变化和相关危害有关的员工的工作岗位将成为下一个砧板。【原文：The jobs of Federal Emergency Management Agency employees tied to climate change and related hazards are next on the chopping block after hundreds of probationary workers were fired earlier this week, according to people familiar with the matter and an internal FEMA email seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 数百个美国石油和黄金项目将接受特朗普的快速审查
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统发布行政命令后，美国陆军工程兵团确定对数百个能源和采矿项目进行紧急快速审查，其中包括密歇根州一条有争议的隧道，用于安桥公司（Enbridge Inc.【原文：A disputed tunnel in Michigan for an Enbridge Inc. oil pipeline is among hundreds of energy and mining projects the US Army Corps of Engineers has identified for emergency fast-track reviews after President Donald Trump’s executive order.】

item.title: CDPQ 和 Systra 赢得加拿大高速铁路项目竞标
item.description: 加拿大将多伦多和魁北克市之间长达 1,000 公里（621 英里）的高速客运铁路项目合同授予由魁北克储蓄与安置银行牵头的一个集团。【原文：Canada awarded a contract for a 1,000-kilometer (621-mile) high-speed passenger rail project between Toronto and Quebec City to a group led by the Caisse de Depot et Placement du Quebec.】

item.title: 欧盟将拨出专款保护海底电缆免遭破坏
item.description: 欧盟将加强对可能遭到破坏的数千英里海底电缆的资助和监控，以更好地保护集团的能源和数字安全。【原文：The European Union will boost funding and surveillance for thousands of miles of undersea cables at risk of sabotage, to better protect the bloc’s energy and digital security.】

item.title: 寒流袭击全美一亿人
item.description: 美国东部和中部地区，包括德克萨斯州全州在内，有 1 亿多人正面临寒冷的天气，因为一场北极风暴有可能打破低温记录。【原文：More than 100 million people are facing frigid conditions across the eastern and central US, including the entire state of Texas, as an arctic blast threatens to break low-temperature records.】

item.title: 亚洲银行坚持华尔街放弃的净零集团
item.description: 在华尔街和加拿大贷款机构纷纷退出后，几家大型亚洲银行也加入了欧洲同行的行列，为业界最大的气候联盟提供支持。【原文：Several large Asian banks have joined their European peers in offering support to the industry’s biggest climate alliance, after a wave of exits by Wall Street and Canadian lenders.】

item.title: 贝莱德在美国证券交易委员会调查后停止与公司谈判
item.description: 全球最大的基金管理公司贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc., the world’s largest money manager, put on hold stewardship conversations with portfolio companies, following new guidance from the US Securities and Exchange Commission, according to a company spokesperson.】

item.title: 绿色进程放缓，汇丰银行将气候目标推迟至 2050 年
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）将实现一些关键气候目标的最后期限推迟20年至2050年，并将重新审视其他目标，坚称其努力受到全球去碳化步伐缓慢的阻碍。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc delayed a deadline to meet some key climate targets by two decades to 2050 and will review other goals, insisting its efforts are being hampered by the slow pace of global efforts on decarbonization.】

item.title: 中国修改电力市场规则，挑战可再生能源的蓬勃发展
item.description: 中国可再生能源的空前繁荣正面临着来自政府规定的新挑战，这些规定将允许市场力量决定新的风能和太阳能发电的价格。【原文：China’s unprecedented boom in renewable energy is facing a fresh challenge from government rules that will allow market forces to determine the price of new wind and solar power.】

item.title: 特朗普称正在审查雪佛龙委内瑞拉石油出口项目
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，雪佛龙公司继续从委内瑞拉出口原油的能力正在接受审查，这表明美国愿意对这家石油巨头在南美国家的业务实施更严格的限制。【原文：Chevron Corp.’s ability to continue exporting crude from Venezuela is under review, President Donald Trump said, signaling an openness to tighter restraints on the oil giant’s operations in the South American country.】

item.title: 一个小岛国出售护照以应对气候变化
item.description:
为重新安置受洪水威胁的瑙鲁约 1 万人所做的努力表明，全球适应资金缺口估计每年高达 3590 亿美元。【原文：

Efforts to relocate about 10,000 people on flooding-threatened Nauru illustrate a gap in global adaptation funding estimated at as much as $359 billion a year. 

】

item.title: 能源转移公司泄漏事件凸显美国最严重的燃料泄漏记录
item.description: 根据彭博社汇编的数据，Energy Transfer LP 旗下的 Sunoco Pipeline LP 公司是宾夕法尼亚州一家输油管道的运营商，监管机构称该输油管道泄漏航空燃油的时间超过 16 个月。【原文：Energy Transfer LP’s Sunoco Pipeline LP unit, the operator of a Pennsylvania pipeline that regulators say leaked jet fuel for more than 16 months, spilled more refined fuels than any other operator in 2024, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 野火如何颠覆加州保险市场
item.description: 1 月份席卷洛杉矶的大火将对该州本已压力重重的保险市场产生深远而持久的影响。【原文：The fires that swept through Los Angeles in January will have deep and long-lasting effects on the state’s already stressed insurance market.】

item.title: 布鲁克林出租大楼将在可持续发展方面创下新纪录
item.description: 纽约一家开发商公布了在布鲁克林市中心建造一座公寓楼的计划，该公寓楼将远远超过城市和州的能效标准，并将成为世界上最高的同类建筑。【原文：A New York developer is unveiling plans for an apartment tower in downtown Brooklyn that will far exceed city and state energy-efficiency standards and be the tallest building of its kind in the world.】

item.title: 污水泄漏、账单增加— 英国水危机解析
item.description: 在系统性污水泄漏和管道长期漏水丑闻的影响下，英国自来水行业正准备进行自 1989 年私有化以来最大规模的改革。经过数十年的投资不足，用户将通过有史以来最大的家庭和企业账单涨幅来承担解决问题的成本。【原文：Britain’s water industry is bracing for the biggest overhaul since privatization in 1989 amid a scandal over systematic sewage spills and chronic pipe leaks. After decades of underinvestment, it’s customers who will shoulder the cost of fixing the problems through the biggest ever bill increase for households and business.】

item.title: 北极空气冻结欧洲，但温暖天气即将到来
item.description: 一股北极气流给欧洲部分地区带来了短暂的寒冷，柏林创下了今冬的最低气温，但温暖的天气即将到来。【原文：A blast of arctic air is bringing a brief frigid snap to parts of Europe, with Berlin recording its lowest temperatures this winter, but warmer weather is on its way.】

item.title: 东盟国家需要超级电网来实现气候目标
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将介绍东南亚地区期待已久的超级电网项目的进展情况。该项目被视为该地区清洁能源转型的关键。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at progress on a long-vaunted supergrid across Southeast Asia. The project is seen as essential for the region’s clean energy transition.】

item.title: DeepSeek 正在为中国气象局的预报提供支持
item.description: 中国国家气象局正在考虑使用 DeepSeek（一家本地初创公司，其人工智能模型上个月震动了全球市场）来支持其预报和观测工作。【原文：China’s state weather agency is considering using DeepSeek, the local startup whose artificial intelligence model shook global markets last month, to power its forecasts and observations.】

item.title: 日本设定 2035 年减排目标 被视为未达到全球目标
item.description: 根据修订后的气候目标，日本将力争在 2035 年之前将温室气体排放量从 2013 年的水平减少 60%，这一政策被认为没有达到实现《巴黎协定》目标所需的行动。【原文：Japan will aim to cut greenhouse gas emissions 60% by 2035 from 2013 levels under a revised climate target, a policy seen as falling short of action required to meet Paris Agreement goals.】
